entry.title: Use WeakPtr for MoveLoopMouseWatcher::host_.
entry.content:
While MoveLoopMouseWatcher is only created in a single place (i.e., in

HWNDMessageHandler::RunMoveLoop()) and lives for the scope of the

method, HWNDMessageHandler may be destroyed at the end of that method's

scope. When that happens, MoveLoopMouseWatcher's pointer to its host

becomes invalid.



To prevent this from happening, this CL replaces the raw pointer that

MoveLoopMouseWatcher keeps to its host by a weak pointer.



Bug: 1469136

Change-Id: Ia9c5c012a95e18be86251481c8302c6c3b79a73b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5245709

entry.title: Shutdown XrHostActivity when browser ends session
entry.content:
Once the XrHostActivity has been created, if the browser process (or

OpenXrDevice code) ends the session (or rejects the session creation),

we can be left in a state where the XrHostActivity is left at the top of

the activity stack.



This change addresses this by calling `finish` on the activity, unless

the shutdown was initiated by it (indicated by it calling new methods to

indicate such). When a shutdown was initiated by it, the activity is

nulled out so that no additional cleanup is done. It is expected that in

these situations the activity will handle disposing of itself.



Bug: 1435548

Change-Id: I6b43c1456b6dfae4e1bb708614eea814a1b06292

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5241674

Commit-Queue: Alexander Cooper

Reviewed-by: Brandon Jones

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1254017}

entry.title: [sync] Allow wallet types to run despite passphrase
entry.content:
Historic background: there was an attempt in https://crbug.com/1413721

to roll out this behavioral change via variations, but it was never

pursued and the code was finally cleaned up in

https://crrev.com/c/4225199, ~four years after deciding against the

behavior in the initial launch, before which the flag was disabled by

default in https://crrev.com/c/1724749.



It isn't clear why AutofillWalletModelTypeController needs to disable

these features for custom passphrase users in transport mode, but the

last patch linked above does say "It was decided not to launch this for

now".



This patch reverts this decision and actually enables those features

for custom passphrase users too, on all platforms (it was already the

case on iOS before this patch because feature

kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos is enabled).



The affected features include:

1) NON-encryptable types:

syncer::AUTOFILL_WALLET_DATA

syncer::AUTOFILL_WALLET_OFFER

syncer::AUTOFILL_WALLET_USAGE



2) Encryptable types (as per syncer::EncryptableUserTypes()):

syncer::AUTOFILL_WALLET_METADATA

syncer::AUTOFILL_WALLET_CREDENTIAL



The types listed first, with non-encryptable types, don't actually care

if an explicit passphrase is set, and there is no known product

requirement that speaks for excluding those users. With this patch,

those features will activate for users in transport mode with a

custom passphrase set.



As per encryptable types: AUTOFILL_WALLET_CREDENTIAL isn't launched

yet and guarded behind kSyncAutofillWalletCredentialData, hence not a

behavioral change here.



The second one, syncer::AUTOFILL_WALLET_METADATA, is the one remaining

interesting case. In practice it won't run anyway in most cases because

the user cannot have entered the passphrase (there is no UI for it for

transport mode on desktop). Hence, the outcome is that most wallet

datatypes become enabled except AUTOFILL_WALLET_METADATA.



Wallet features don't strictly need AUTOFILL_WALLET_METADATA to provide

a decent user experience, so it seems better than turning off all

functionality.



Change-Id: Ie33d4f3db4b4da270f0d9109506bb4eaacb135c1

AXMenuList when it is indirectly called by the AXMenuListPopup, before

the AXMenuList has had its cached values updated.

entry.title: Allow downgrade versions earlier than the bundled version
entry.content:
Component Update supports downgrading of versions in order to support

rollbacks. However, if the component is also bundled, then currently

you can not rollback to a version earlier than the bundled version.

Adding support so that the bundled version is skipped if it has been

seen before and there is a downgrade.



This is done by keeping track of the maximum previous version in the

component updater preferences for the component (as `max_pv`).

In the case of a downgrade (say v2 reverted back to v1), then v2 would

be saved as the previous max, and when selecting which version to use,

the bundled version will only be used if its version is greater than

this saved max. If the bundled version changes to something bigger

(say v3), then it will be used instead of v1.



Bug: 1445973

entry.title: Rename {absl => std}::optional in //media/
entry.content:
#cleanup



Automated patch. This is a no-op. Please avoid, as much as possible,

assigning unrelated bugs to this.



Context:

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/cxx/c/nBD_1LaanTc/m/ghh-ZZhWAwAJ?utm_medium=email



As of https://crrev.com/1204351, absl::optional is now a type alias

for std::optional. We should migrate toward it.



Script:

```

cd media/

function replace {

echo "Replacing $1 by $2"

git grep -l "$1" \

| cut -f1 -d: \

| grep \

-e "\.h" \

-e "\.cc" \

-e "\.mm" \

| sort \

| uniq \

| xargs sed -i "s/$1/$2/g"

}

replace "absl::make_optional" "std::make_optional"

replace "absl::optional" "std::optional"

replace "absl::nullopt" "std::nullopt"

replace "absl::in_place" "std::in_place"

replace "absl::in_place_t" "std::in_place_t"

replace "\"third_party\/abseil-cpp\/absl\/types\/optional.h\"" ""

cd ..



echo "Formatting:"



echo "IncludeBlocks: Regroup" >> ".clang-format"

echo "IncludeIsMainRegex: \"(_(android|apple|chromeos|freebsd|fuchsia|fuzzer|ios|linux|mac|nacl|openbsd|posix|stubs?|win))?(_(unit|browser|perf)?tests?)?$\"" >> ".clang-format"

git cl format

git restore ".clang-format"



git cl format

```



Bug: chromium:1500249

entry.title: Migrate SystemMessageWindowWin to SingletonHwnd
entry.content:
The current implementation of SystemMessageWindowWin creates message-

only windows to listen for events from Windows. This impacts

performance at startup where we have to pay the cost to creating the window to listen. Instead use Singleton HWND in the implementation

of this component to allow sharing a single HWND. We typically see 1-10ms costs for creating an HWND in startup, so sharing the Singleton HWND will lead to modest but measurable startup improvements.

entry.title: [Private Network Access] Disable CORS header checks on pure PNA preflights
entry.content:
Per discussions in [1], we don't really need to do all the CORS header

checks when a preflight is only for PNA and not required for CORS. If

we don't do those checks, we wouldn't need to relax the CORS

safelisted header limit just for PNA preflights before navigation.



This CL introduces a preflight mode, which can be either:

1. kCORS, meaning the preflight is for CORS only.

2. kPNA, meaning the preflight is for PNA only.

3. kCORS | kPNA, meaning the preflight is for both CORS and PNA.



When the CORS bit is not set, we do not send the access control headers

(except Access-Control-Request-Method) and skip the cross-origin header

tests. We keep the Origin header because the site needs this information

to decide whether to allow private network requests.





[1] https://github.com/WICG/private-network-access/issues/116

entry.title: [Soft-Navigations] Remove paint requirements to Emit entry.
entry.content:
This patch continues to track of all Paints which follow an Interaction

which may start a new soft-navigation. If those paints are deemed

attributable to the Interaction (i.e. due to a Dom Modification that was

know task-attributable), only then does that paint "count" towards a

total soft-navigation painted area.



Previously, we would require to see a 2% paint area update (as compared

to some default area, approximately the viewport size).



With this change, we remove that requirement entirely, but leave the

calculation, as it is useful for tracing / logging and may be added to

histogram data.



This patch also cleans up some of the paint tracking logic and fixes a

few small issues where paints could "bleed" across navigations by

accidentally accumulating paint area even after an entry is emitted.

Instead of mistakely accumulating for the *next* soft-nav, we accumulate

a total for the current soft-nav. This helps mark the maximum total

painted area after a soft-nav (i.e. to see what the threshold could

have been).



Future work will want to resolve some of the reasons paints are not

being correctly attributed, and then we may re-enable this requirement.

entry.title: Language packs: Fix Google TTS and LP mojo connection error
entry.content:
This change fixes a bug that occurs when Google TTS calls

LanguagePacksImpl::UninstallPack() (see the bug for more details on

the exact errors), which eventually breaks the mojo connection between

the two components.



The solution here is to ensure that LanguagePacks runs the mojo

callback that is passed into UninstallPack. This ensures that the

mojo connection is preserved and that the other end of the pipe, in

this case Google TTS, is notified that the uninstall was completed.



Bug: b:322014742

Test: Manually on-device. Flash the most recent version of Google TTS,

Test: then flash this change to the same device. Ensure that TTS

Test: language packs can be installed and uninstalled without

Test: emitting console errors or crashing the Chromebook.

entry.title: [ios] Create `CustomHighlightableButton` and let toolbar button
entry.content:
subclass it.



`CustomHighlightableButton` is created so the highlighting logic can

be more self-contained by the button itself, alleviating the

plumbing needed to pass the call to its immediate parent in the view

hierarchy who is otherwise holding the highlighting logic.



Use the new mechanism to highlight the Share button when an IPH is shown

for it.



Follow up works are marked to-do: refactor the existing plumbing to use

this new mechanism.



An alternative not pursued is put the highlighting logic into

UIButton's Category. Due to the limitations of Obj-C Category, Subclass

ispreferred.

entry.title: kiosk: Add a parent window to the diagnose dialog
entry.content:
This is the diagnose dialog reachable from the network dialog during

Kiosk launch. The dialog is currently broken, when you click "diagnose"

nothing happens at the time. The dialog is actually created behind the

splash screen, and sometimes is visible above the Kiosk app after

launch.



When in-session the dialog can be leveraged among other bugs to escape

Kiosk.



This change adds a parent window to the dialog, so it is displayed in

the login screen correctly and gets closed when the login screen is gone

after Kiosk launches.



"diagnose", see the dialog appears, connect to internet, see the kiosk

launches and the dialog disappears.



Bug: b:322775376

entry.content:
Use the height of the StatusIndicator as a topMargin for the

HubContainerView. This ensures the two views don't overlap.



The transition animation is not particularly smooth because the Hub is

not a composited layer and it seems the StatusIndicator height updates

aren't granular enough to animate smoothly in Java.



This might be possible to fix by using BrowserControls height

information instead, but that is likely best saved for a later polish

CL.

entry.title: [CSC] Produce more distinct errors
entry.content:
Allow Web applications to more easily distinguish the source of an error

by providing the following mapping of errors:

* NotAllowedError: User withheld permission (or the permission system

did so on the user's behalf, e.g. due to embargo).

* NotFoundError: Capturing or captured surface not found. Would normally

be encountered if the API invocation, which is asynchronous, roughly

coincided with the closing of either capturing application, the

closing of the captured tab, or the termination of the capture

session.

* InvalidStateError: The API invocation was disallowed at the current

state of the capture, e.g. if self-capturing. Note that this may

sometimes change due to asynchronous user interaction, as for example

with share-this-tab-instead being clicked. Another possible source of

this error is when the capturing application is not focused; this is

detectable by the app (through the blur event), but is not always

avoidable, as the user might activate another tab shortly after the

application calls one of the CSC APIs.

* UnknownError: This remains the catch-all error for any

non-differentiated error cause.



Bug: 1466247

Change-Id: I8cb59d6fdd3412324d7e06f6dada38cc20b19f3e

entry.title: Add enum for Autofill.WebView.Events histogram.
entry.content:
The original bitmask is simply too hard to read. I expect to remove

this histogram once AndroidAutofillSupportVisibilityChanges is launched.



The entries were generated using the following script:



def main():

components = [

[1 << i, name]

for i, name in enumerate([

"structure sent",

"suggestion shown",

"autofilled",

"changed field",

"changed autofilled field",

"changed visibility",

"submitted",

"bottom sheet",

])

]



def generate_labels(x):

joined_labels = ", ".join((label for bit, label in components

if x & bit))

return joined_labels.capitalize() if len(joined_labels) else "None"



for i in range(0, 1 << len(components)):

print(f'')





if __name__ == "__main__":

main()





Bug: 1482048

entry.title: Reland "[base] Integrate (Sequenced|SingleThread)TaskRunner::GetCurrentDefault with RunOrPostTask."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit aa9fbff84283de17fe0ee59c28c9edd50b7e6d3a



Gardener said that since

ToolbarControllerUiTest.DeactivatedActionItemsOverflow started

failing before this CL landed and kept failing after it was reverted,

they no longer think it was causing the issue.



Original change's description:

> [base] Integrate (Sequenced|SingleThread)TaskRunner::GetCurrentDefault with RunOrPostTask.

>

> Within a RunOrPostTask callback running synchronously:

>

> - There is no "current default SingleThreadTaskRunner".

>

> A RunOrPostTask() callback cannot make assumptions about the thread

> on which it runs, so it shouldn't access the current default

> SingleThreadTaskRunner.

>

> - The "current default SequencedTaskRunner" is the SequenceManager's

> default task runner.

>

> A RunOrPostTask() callback runs in sequence with tasks from the

> target SequenceManager. It's appropriate for it to access the

> "current default" SequencedTaskRunner.

>

> Also, with this CL, when

> SingleThreadTaskRunner::BelongsToCurrentThread() is invoked on a

> task runner that runs tasks posted to it "in sequence" with the

> current RunOrPostTask callback running synchronously, but on

> a different thread, it returns `false`. In the same context,

> SingleThreadTaskRunner::RunsTasksInCurrentSequence() returns true.

>

> Bug: 1503967

> Change-Id: I017442f10eddda9070a29fb6cf0fa38dcd14a88c

entry.title: [anchor] Pass available PhysicalSize to AnchorEvaluatorImpl constructor
entry.content:
The current API relies on the "just-in-time" SetAxis call to provide

the size along the relevant axis. However, this API is hard to satisfy

when resolving anchor() functions by interleaving style updates from

layout (crbug.com/1510829), as by the time we know the relevant axis,

we're deep in the style code, and we have no idea what the available

size is.



Hence, this CL instead passes the full PhysicalSize to the

AnchorEvaluatorImpl in the first place, and then relies on is_y_axis

to select either the width or the height evaluation-time.



There should be no behavior change in this CL. It's a preparation

that makes it easier to resolve anchor() functions during style

resolution.



Bug: 1510829

Change-Id: Iab2ff2edf7b9b1d0ed44d08d51d69af3bab16799

entry.title: Revert "snap-group: SVOVS creation revamp"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 86b24c235071b778f7de8cc5d5a6e1f020722f5a.



Reason for revert:

Appears to cause MSan failures, like those seen in:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/40979/overview



Original change's description:

> snap-group: SVOVS creation revamp

>

> This cl completed the major revamp of the SVOVS creation by

> focusing on the following items:

> 1. Don't bypass SVOVS creation in `WindowState::OnWMEvent()`;

> 2. Remove `auto_snap_controller_` owned by SVOVS as the instance

> has been owned by `SplitViewController`, with this cl SVOVS can only

> by created through `SplitViewController`;

> 3. Refresh snapped window bounds upon snap group creation and removal

> by adjusting current API;

> 4. Unify handling when divider is created in clamshell in

> `SplitViewDivider::RefreshSplitViewDividerInClamshell()`;

> 5. Further reduce the misusages of the feature flag;

> 6. Remove the !InSplitViewMode() in `SplitViewController` when it

> doesn't make sense.

>

> TODO:

> - The snapped window bounds calculation differ between clamshell and

> tablet split view with the existence of divider. This needs to be

> unified, currently the calculation in snap group is correct;

> - Re-enable the unit test when divider refactor work completes.

>

> Fixed: b/321093825

> Test: Update / fix existing tests + manual

entry.title: [css-nesting] Add invisible rules to aid use-counting
entry.content:
Following up CL:5201402, this CL adds "invisible rules",

which can exist in the children of StyleRules and StyleRuleGroups,

but are not visible unless explicitly accessed via

ChildRuleVector::RawChildRules.



Further CLs will add special handling for quiet rules

in StyleCascade, where we'll first cascade with quiet rules for

signaling purposes (see CSSSelector::Signal), then re-cascade

(if needed) without quiet rules to get the author-visible result.



For now, quiet rules are not used outside of tests.

entry.title: Enable RunTasksByBatches by default on ChromeOS and macOS
entry.content:
It seems that crrev.com/1209460 intended to enable "RunTasksByBatches"

on ChromeOS and MacOS. However, it changed the defaults for

base::kRunTasksByBatches, which is not used. The one in use seems to be

the

base::sequence_manager::internal::anonymous_namespace::kRunTasksByBatches.



Remove the latter and switch to using the former. The opposite does not

work because ProductionSupportedFlagList.java references

BaseFeatures.RUN_TASKS_BY_BATCHES.



Caveat: I do not have links, internal or external, to evidence that

these defaults are better. Assuming olivierli@ and fdoray@ have the

data.

entry.title: Remove TestPrefetchURLLoaderInterceptor
entry.content:
`PrefetchService::GetPrefetchToServe` was totally skipped

in `PrefetchURLLoaderInterceptorTest` because of

`TestPrefetchURLLoaderInterceptor::GetPrefetch`, but this

made the invariants different between tests and non-test code,

for example as discussed in [1].



To make the test coverage more realistic,

this CL removes `TestPrefetchURLLoaderInterceptor` and

use the non-test `PrefetchURLLoaderInterceptor` and

`PrefetchService` code instead.



By doing so, this CL re-enables

`DoNotInterceptNavigationCookiesChanged` test that was

removed due to this invariant inconsistency.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5232813/comment/459b89b8_b127a828/

entry.title: [wpt] Fix unhandled rejection in `scrollend-event-not-fired-...html`
entry.content:
This WPT checks for the absence of a scrollend event by waiting for the

`waitForScrollendEvent()` helper to reject. However, if the rejection

occurs before attaching handlers, the rejection may be returned when

running the test with WebDriver [1] and cause the overall harness status

to flake. The `promise_test()` can still pass because it only awaits the

handled promise.



De-flake the test by immediately attaching the handlers. See also: [2].



[1]: https://wpt.fyi/results/dom/events/scrolling/scrollend-event-not-fired-on-no-scroll.html?label=master&label=experimental&aligned

[2]: https://jakearchibald.com/2023/unhandled-rejections/



Bug: 1499775

Change-Id: I6d7b18053c6ec00ee86dc31914a4a41f9d063ec2

entry.title: [Default Nav Transition]Add GetBackForwardTransitionAnimationManager
entry.content:
on WebContentsView



Currently WCImpl casts [1] a WebContentsView to WebContentsViewAndroid

to get the AnimationManager. However when we attach the inner WC we

replace the WebContentsView from the platform specific impl to

WebContentsViewChildFrame [2]. Then the cast in [1] becomes a bad cast.



A proper way to do this is to have a public API on WebContentsView,

and have platform specific implementations.



Big thanks to Khushal for spotting this.



[1]: https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/web_contents/web_contents_impl.cc;drc=25a9dc176029598d968de92e6cfd7dcb5e6246e4;l=10590

[2]: https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/web_contents/web_contents_impl.cc;l=2779;drc=25a9dc176029598d968de92e6cfd7dcb5e6246e4

entry.title: Revert "Rework text-shadow painting for text decorations"
entry.content:
This reverts commit babe4ea7fdb96aff28ef6a4166abd969eac95a1e.



Reason for revert: Doesn't handle non-opaque colors correctly.



Original change's description:

> Rework text-shadow painting for text decorations

>

> The current painting code-path for text-decorations with text-shadows is

> complicated: line-throughs are painted using a draw-looper while the

> rest of the decorations are painted for each shadow "layer" using a

> DropShadowPaintFilter.

>

> Unify these two by introducing a ScopedTextShadowPainter object that

> constructs a filter - either a single DropShadowPaintFilter or a merge

> filter combining one DropShadowPaintFilter for each layer. This makes

> the two cases consistent, and for non-line-through decorations there's

> no longer a need to run the paint code for each shadow "layer".

>

> Bug: 1521809

> Change-Id: I81235c3882f6518b9e94ccb3235a58787a7410e3

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5237135

> Reviewed-by: Stephen Chenney

> Commit-Queue: Fredrik Söderquist

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1253280}



Bug: 1521809

entry.title: Remove Autofill birthdate types
entry.content:
It was decided to remove the unlaunched, incomplete birthdate support.



This CL removes the birthdate related FieldTypes, FieldTypeGroup and

FieldTypeGroupForMetrics. The birthdate HtmlFieldType is kept, since

bday-day, bday-month and bday-year are standardized autocomplete

attribute values. As of this CL, they map to UNKNOWN_TYPE.



A follow-up CL will remove the FieldTypes from the server-side enum.

entry.title: Split file settings for OneDrive and cloud upload
entry.content:
Before this CL, only the cloud upload flag would determine if settings

for OneDrive integration and cloud upload would be shown. With

enterprise clippy these two settings are independent and therefore

if the OneDrive integration is enabled but cloud upload is disabled,

the OneDrive integration setting should still be shown.

entry.title: iwa: Let SafeWebBundleParser process disconnects
entry.content:
The main aim of this CL to move logic that is processing disconnects

into SafeWebBundleParser class. Conceptually this functionality belongs

to this class as IIUC its aim is to isolate user from IPC related

things.



This CL slightly changes the behavior: in case of disconnect

there will be an attempt to reestablish the connection and after that

in case of failure the error will be returned.



The reconnection is done in a similar way to how we do it now: delete

the old parser&co and create a new one.



For testability reason (and potentially for the different locations of

the Signed Web Bundles, e.g. it might be in memory) I used strategy

design patterns which allows to change how WebBundleDataSource is

created.



Bug: b/320728815

entry.title: Re-enable Autofill i18n sync util unittests
entry.content:
Birthdates are no longer supported by the data model. As a result, the

sync proto <-> AutofillProfile conversion tests no longer pass: The test

expects that after setting birthdate information in the profile (which

is now a no-op) and converting it to a proto, the resulting proto will

have birthdate information set.



This CL removes all birthdate related handling from the sync conversion

logic and re-enables the tests.



(Originally this happened together with crrev.com/c/5240838 - but that

got reverted and will require some additional work)

entry.title: [DBSC] Measure effectiveness of error handling
entry.content:
This CL adds metrics recording the outcome of a request after it had

been deferred by DBSC and what triggered the request release.



One of the expectations we want to check is that network requests

released with the kNetworkConnectionOffline reason should almost always

fail.



It'd be great to record what exact network error led to the

kCookieRefreshFetchFailure outcome. We might want to add more specific

buckets to ResumeBlockedRequestsTrigger in the future CLs.



The outcome of a request is only known in GoogleURLLoaderThrottle, so to

record the histograms we need to plumb a

chrome::mojom::ResumeBlockedRequestsTrigger value from throttled request

handlers through the return value of the existing

BoundSessionRequestThrottledHandler.HandleRequestBlockedOnCookie() Mojo

message.



An alternative to that would be to signal the request result through a

new message in the BoundSessionRequestThrottledHandler Mojo interface,

which seemed less optimal.



Bug: b/292511796

Change-Id: Ic8739f1c788699c1b9fd34024175487c03f11958
